verses.plain: How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince’s daughter! the joints of thy thighs are like jewels, the work of the hands of a cunning workman.

tokens.t: How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince’s daughter! the joints of thy thighs
like jewels, the work of the hands of a cunning workman.

verses.plain: Thy navel is like a round goblet, which wanteth not liquor: thy belly is like an heap of wheat set about with lilies.

tokens.t: Thy navel
a round goblet,
wanteth not liquor: thy belly
an heap of wheat set about with lilies.

verses.plain: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins.

tokens.t: Thy two breasts
like two young roes
twins.

verses.plain: Thy neck is as a tower of ivory; thine eyes like the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bath-rabbim: thy nose is as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.

tokens.t: Thy neck
as a tower of ivory; thine eyes
the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bath-rabbim: thy nose
as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.

verses.plain: Thine head upon thee is like Carmel, and the hair of thine head like purple; the king is held in the galleries.

tokens.t: Thine head upon thee
like Carmel, and the hair of thine head like purple; the king
held in the galleries.

verses.plain: How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!

tokens.t: How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!

verses.plain: This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters of grapes.

tokens.t: This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters

verses.plain: I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, and the smell of thy nose like apples;

tokens.t: I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, and the smell of thy nose like apples;

verses.plain: And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.

tokens.t: And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth
sweetly, causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.

verses.plain: ¶ I am my beloved’s, and his desire is toward me.

tokens.t: ¶ I
my beloved’s, and his desire
toward me.

verses.plain: Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.

tokens.t: Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.

verses.plain: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish, whether the tender grape appear, and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give thee my loves.

tokens.t: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish,
the tender grape appear,
the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give thee my loves.

verses.plain: The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates are all manner of pleasant fruits, new and old, which I have laid up for thee, O my beloved.

tokens.t: The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates
all manner of pleasant
, new and old,
I have laid up for thee, O my beloved.

footnotes.text: of those…: or, of the ancient
